definition: Qi state of Western Zhou and the Warring states (1122-265 BC), centered in Shandong
(name of states and dynasties at several different periods)/surname Qi
neat/even/level with/identical/simultaneous/all together/to even sth out
country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]
surname Guo

sentences.english: The king of Zhao accpeted the gifts gladly and sent a hundred thousand troops to help Qi.
sentences.chinese: 趙王見了禮物十分高興，派了十萬士兵去援助齊國。

sentences.english: One year, there was a great famine in the State of Qi.
sentences.chinese: 有一年，齊國發生了特大的饑荒。

sentences.english: Later when the state of qi guanzhong ruler, and cao foam did lu general.
sentences.chinese: 後來管仲當了齊國的宰相，而曹沫做了魯國的將軍。

sentences.english: Chu and Qi were only able to compete with them.
sentences.chinese: 當時只有楚國和齊國能與之抗衡。

sentences.english: Qi began to  launch the second round of attacks. They beat the drums again.
sentences.chinese: 齊國開始發動第二輪進攻，他們重新擂起戰鼓。

sentences.english: The Ji-xia academy was a famous institution of Qi in the Warring States Period.
sentences.chinese: 稷下學宮是戰國時期齊國的一所著名學府。

sentences.english: A carpenter called Shijun someday passed by Quyuan, a place in the State of Qi.
sentences.chinese: 木匠石君有一天路過齊國一個叫曲轅的地方。

sentences.english: After the foundation of the Qi, salt economy was paid attention to.
sentences.chinese: 齊國建立之後，鹽業經濟受到了重點關注。

sentences.english: He uttered the hardship of the mission to Confucius as soon as talk started.
sentences.chinese: 沈先生一見面就向孔子傾述這回出使齊國的艱難之處。

sentences.english: There is a big bird which has lived in the palace for three years.
sentences.chinese: 齊國有一隻大鳥，棲在王宮的庭院裏依然整整三年了。

sentences.english: Qi is the main currency of the country to use a knife.
sentences.chinese: 齊國是使用刀幣的主要國家。

sentences.english: Duke Huan appointed Guan Zhong the chief minister, and yet the state of Qi was not peaceful and orderly.
sentences.chinese: 桓公任命管仲作上卿，可是齊國還不太平。

sentences.english: As you know, it is well known how Qi treats missioner.
sentences.chinese: 可是你知道齊國對待使節陽奉陰違是出了名的。

sentences.english: Duke Huan bestowed on him the revenues from the commodity tax of Qi for one year, yet the state was not peaceful and orderly.
sentences.chinese: 桓公賜給他齊國一年的貨物稅，可是齊國還不太平。

sentences.english: Duke Huan bestowed on him the revenues from the commodity tax of Qi for one year, yet the state was not peaceful and orderly.
sentences.chinese: 桓公賜給他齊國一年的貨物稅，可是齊國還不太平。

sentences.english: Recently there appeared two works that mentioned the so-called Qi State bird-worm inscription existing in the Qi bronze wares.
sentences.chinese: 近來有兩種論著提到所謂齊國銅器中的鳥蟲書。

definition: Duke Huan of Qi (reigned 685-643 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei
the state of Qin, one of the seven states of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
Lord Menchang of Qi, Chancellor of Qi and of Wei during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
Linzi district of Zibo city 淄博市[Zi1 bo2 shi4], Shandong
Lu, vassal state at the time of the Zhou Dynasty 周朝|周朝[Zhou1 chao2], located in the southwest of present-day Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1], birthplace of Confucius

feudal vassal/feudal princes, esp. the monarchs (dukes or princes) of the several vassal states 諸侯國|诸侯国 of Zhou during Western Zhou and Spring and Autumn periods 11th-5th century BC/subordinate warlord/local official
Duke Wen of Jin (697-628 BC, reigned 636-628 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
vassal state
monarch
posthumous name of the first Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦 (256 or 247-195 BC), reigned 202-195 BC
vassal state
Zuo Zhuan or Tsochuan, Mr Zuo's Annals or Mr Zuo's commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history c. 400 BC attributed to famous blind historian Zuo Qiuming 左丘明[Zuo3 Qiu1 ming2]
capital of a country (literary)
Wei State (407-225 BC), one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Wei State or Cao Wei 曹魏 (220-265), the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms
Emperor Wu of the Han dynasty (141-87 BC)
